message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We compared the performance of two machine learning models using data from the Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES) and the Labor Force Survey (LFS).", "dataset": ["Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES)", "Labor Force Survey (LFS)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "In this analysis, we used a novel dataset of satellite imagery to assess deforestation patterns in Brazil's Amazon rainforest.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data on ODA disbursements from the OECD Creditor Reporting System and aid-for-trade flows from the WTO Integrated Trade Intelligence Portal for 96 developing countries over 14 years.", "dataset": ["OECD Creditor Reporting System", "WTO Integrated Trade Intelligence Portal"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Global Finance Initiative Survey, this paper examines how access to finance affects firm productivity across different income groups and sectors in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Global Finance Initiative Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the impact of covid-19 on smallholder farmers in sub-Saharan Africa, we analyzed mobile phone data collected by the MISTOWA project, which provides real-time data on weather, prices, and farmer behaviors.", "dataset": ["mobile phone data collected by the MISTOWA project"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS), we examined the relationship between breastfeeding practices and child mortality in 23 developing countries.", "dataset": ["Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This article presents results from two complementary datasets: the Living Standards and Measurement Surveys (LSMS-ISA) and the Demographic Health Surveys (DHS), to assess the impact of social safety net programs on labor market outcomes and household welfare in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Living Standards and Measurement Surveys (LSMS-ISA)", "Demographic Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We used household survey data from 12 African countries and applied a propensity score matching algorithm to estimate the causal effects of migration on rural income and welfare.", "dataset": ["household survey data"], "topic": ["Migration", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the Enterprise Surveys, we investigated how firm-level innovation activities are affected by factors such as access to finance, regulatory environment, and workforce skills.", "dataset": ["Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a combination of remote sensing data, hydrological modeling, and ground-based measurements to study the impacts of climate change on water resources in the Himalayan region.", "dataset": ["remote sensing data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Water"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We compared the performance of two machine learning models using data from the Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES) and the Labor Force Survey (LFS).", "dataset": workforce skills.", "dataset": ["Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a combination of remote sensing data, hydrological modeling, and ground-based measurements to study the impacts of climate change on water resources in the Himalayan region.", "dataset": ["remote sensing data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Water"]}]
